abstract: This article discusses the culture of digital citation within the humanities, with specific reference to research done on the citation of two well-used digital resources: British History Online and the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. Because these two resources are available in both print and digital form, they provide a good test case of whether academics prefer to cite print sources when they have used digital resources in their research.
article_title: A Culture of non-citation: Assessing the digital impact of British History Online and the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

affiliation.original_name: Institute of Historical Research, University of London
